item.title: Tamagotchi Plaza ‘Takoyaki Shop’ update now available
item.content:encoded:

“The Takoyaki Shop is now open for business in Tamahiko Town as a free update,” reads the announcement. “Spin the takoyaki and add toppings to make delicious takoyaki for your customers!”

item.title: Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake ‘Seabed’ trailer, screenshots
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

A new adventure awaits in Dragon Quest II.

Publisher Square Enix and developer Artdink Corporation have released a new trailer for Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake introducing the “seabed,” a new setting for adventure in Dragon Quest II.

The seabed is where players will find the unknown city of Almeha, a suspicious ship wandering the ocean floor, a vault of treasures, a sanctuary of mermaids, formidable foes, and the “Memories of the World” that chronicle the unknown history of Alefgard.

Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on October 30. Digital pre-orders are available now for all platforms.

item.title: Suika Game Planet announced for Switch 2, Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch
  • Switch 2

Due out this winter.

Aladdin X has announced Suika Game Planet for Switch 2 and Switch. It will launch digitally this winter as a timed console exclusive.

According to a FAQ on the game’s official website, there are no major differences between the Switch 2 and Switch versions of the game, other than the Switch 2 version supporting GameShare. The FAQ also states that while the game will be digital-only at launch, a physical edition is under consideration for Japan. As for whether the game will be released for “smartphones, game consoles other than Switch, or PC,” plans are “currently undecided.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Aladdin X:

The hit puzzle game returns in outer space. Collide matching fruit to “evolve” them into larger fruit and higher scores. Drop fruit towards the center of the planet to create as many big watermelons (Suika) as possible, and net bonus points by triggering new Super Evolution combos. Suika Game Planet on Nintendo Switch 2 also features an exclusive local four-player cooperative mode with GameShare.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: Overcooked 2! – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition announced
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Due out this winter.

Publisher Team17 and developer Ghost Town Games have announced Overcooked! 2 – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition. It will launch this winter for $29.99 / £24.99 / €29.99. Users who the Switch version will be able to upgrade to the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition for $9.99 / £7.99 / €9.99.

Overcooked! 2 first launched for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, PC, Mac, and Linux on August 7, 2018, followed by Luna on October 20, 2020, Xbox Series on November 10, 2020, and PlayStation 5 on November 12, 2020. The PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series versions are available via the Overcooked! All You Can Eat, which includes both Overcooked! and Overcooked! 2 and all downloadable content. Overcooked! All You Can Eat is also available for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC.

Here is an overview of the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition, via Team17:

This new version of Overcooked! 2 features the classic kitchen chaos you know and love but with shiny new Switch 2-exclusive features:

  • Enhanced graphics in line with PC
  • 4K resolution / 60 frames per second gameplay when docked—enjoy those kitchen fires in 4k
  • Camera Play—enjoy all the laughter AND the shouting
  • Game Share
  • A new Platinum Platypus Chef

Chefs will still be able to play with Nintendo Switch players and any downloadable content you already own will remain. For those worrying about save files, have no fear as progression can be transferred back and forth between both platforms.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: Human Fall Flat – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition announced
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Due out in spring 2026.

Publisher Curve Games and developer XXX have announced Human Fall Flat – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition. It will launch in spring 2026.

Human Fall Flat first launched for PC, Mac, and Linux on July 22, 2016, followed by PlayStation 4 on May 9, 2017, Xbox One on May 12, 2017, Switch on December 7, 2017, iOS and Android on June 2, 2019, Xbox Series on May 28, 2021, and PlayStation 5 on June 24, 2021. It has sold over 55 million copies.

“Having sold 4.2 million units [on Switch] globally, Human Fall Flat is already a household name for many Switch owners,” said Curve Games CEO Stuart Dinsey in a press release. “We are hugely excited to be working with Nintendo to bring it to Switch 2 owners with added levels and features by spring next year.”

Here is an overview of the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition, via Curve Games:

About

This enhanced edition brings the full dose of charm, chaos, and creativity fans adore—now optimized for Nintendo’s next-generation console. Players can dive into a delightful mix of brand-new levels, including Dockyard, Museum, Hike, and the sugary sweet Candyland, alongside timeless fan-favourites like Castle, Aztec, and Water. Even better: all future levels will be included.

Step into surreal, floating dreamscapes where every stage offers a fresh playground for exploration and puzzle-solving. From snowy mountain peaks to eerie factories and candy-coated wonderlands, each level challenges players to experiment, laugh, and find their own path forward.

Whether you’re upgrading from the original Nintendo Switch version or jumping in for the first time, the Nintendo Switch 2 Edition ensures the ultimate Human Fall Flat experience.

Key Features

  • All Current and Future Levels – From classics to brand-new worlds.
  • Online Multiplayer for Up to 8 Players – Where teamwork, chaos, and laughter collide.
  • Endless Possibilities – Push, pull, climb, flop, and fumble your way through ingenious puzzles, solo or with friends.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4 coming to PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2 this fall
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

A look at some of the improvements.

Publisher Bandai Namco and Koei Tecmo developer Omega Force will release One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4 for Switch 2 alongside its previously announced PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series versions this fall, the companies announced.

One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4 first launched for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on March 26, 2020.

The PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2 versions will offer more detailed graphics and more enemies on screen. Here is a pair of comparisons showing the upgrade from the PlayStation 4 version to the PlayStation 5 version:

Users who already own the game for the same family of consoles will be able to upgrade to the new version. In Japan, the PlayStation 4 and Switch versions will cost 100 yen to upgrade, while the Xbox One upgrade will be a free upgrade. Western upgrade pricing is currently unknown.

item.title: Persona 3 Reload demo for Switch 2 now available
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Save data from the demo can be carried over to the full game.

ATLUS has released a demo for the Switch 2 version of Persona 3 Reload via Nintendo eShop.

Like the existing versions of the demo, users can play through the story’s opening up until the first major boss battle, and save data can be carried over to the full game when it launches.

Persona 3 Reload is currently available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store. The Switch 2 version will launch on October 23.
